commit_message:
Refactor update_segment_host_mapping_for_agent for agentless topology

Current update_segment_host_mapping_for_agent will accept agent object
and update segment_host_mapping according to agent object. For the
agentless topology(for example, networking ovn), there will be no l2 agent
object. The only information will be host and physical networks.

This patch refactor update_segment_host_mapping_for_agent to let agentless
topology to reuse the existing code.

Change-Id: If03e6a734a2b2df5259e7c7b5d7069dca144a005
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

subject: Change USED_IPS variable to a Python set
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-22 14:55:03.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': "Change USED_IPS variable to a Python set

USED_IPS being a list did not convey it's intention of limiting IP
addresses to only one instance. Using the set data type does this, and
removes the need for iterating over the USED_IP array from our own code.

Other lists within the code that use the 'append_if' function were not
changed here because the set datatype does not get written as a list in
YAML, which may be undesirable. It may be completely possible to cast
sets as lists on output, but this patch is largely about clarifying
intent around USED_IPS so the set-to-list dump logic wasn't explored.

Also, the duplicate IP tests were left in place due to the fact that the
IP addresses are populated into a queue structure separately, which may
still have bugs that don't belong to Python or netaddr. In the future,
it may be desirable to modify the IP-handling logic to completely use
netaddr's specialized classes.

Change-Id: I22312321738d1f1001984d4c81f7fd24b7a1f1c8
"}]
commit_message:
Change USED_IPS variable to a Python set

USED_IPS being a list did not convey it's intention of limiting IP
addresses to only one instance. Using the set data type does this, and
removes the need for iterating over the USED_IP array from our own code.

Other lists within the code that use the 'append_if' function were not
changed here because the set datatype does not get written as a list in
YAML, which may be undesirable. It may be completely possible to cast
sets as lists on output, but this patch is largely about clarifying
intent around USED_IPS so the set-to-list dump logic wasn't explored.

Also, the duplicate IP tests were left in place due to the fact that the
IP addresses are populated into a queue structure separately, which may
still have bugs that don't belong to Python or netaddr. In the future,
it may be desirable to modify the IP-handling logic to completely use
netaddr's specialized classes.

Change-Id: I22312321738d1f1001984d4c81f7fd24b7a1f1c8

revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2016-06-23 00:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/subscription-confirmation-support.rst'], 'message': "Subscription confirmation support

Currently Zaqar can post notifications to the subscriber
once the subscription is created.
It doesn't need the subscriber to confirm the subscription.

This will lead a problem that users could send junk
information that whether subscriber want or not.

So we should support to confirm subscription by using
HTTP request like what Amazon SNS is doing.

Change-Id: I43c202e86a7a6a9605747096f707104d2d699010
Implements: blueprint subscription-confirmation-support
"}]
commit_message:
Subscription confirmation support

Currently Zaqar can post notifications to the subscriber
once the subscription is created.
It doesn't need the subscriber to confirm the subscription.

This will lead a problem that users could send junk
information that whether subscriber want or not.

So we should support to confirm subscription by using
HTTP request like what Amazon SNS is doing.

Change-Id: I43c202e86a7a6a9605747096f707104d2d699010
Implements: blueprint subscription-confirmation-support

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/commmon in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator, so don't
use this directory any more. We also removed this from
cookiecutter in I7bfb899f8b94e4dc19fd4cef43466a5baac3a3ec.

Change-Id: I3270db9dbaffccfde184d5fc17aed73359fe86dd

commit_message:
Use DummyYaqlYamlLoader to load classes during upload

This commit changes the loader, that loads MuranoPL classes during
package upload to DummyYaqlYamlLoader. This would allow importing and parsing
packages that contain '!yaql' tag without any errors, when importing to
glare.

Change-Id: I9071bb479019cac20bf61f110154082063c9d777
Closes-Bug: #1586028

subject: Match ansible output for console
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 23:39:25.000000000', 'files': ['os_loganalyze/filter.py', 'os_loganalyze/tests/samples/console-ansible.html.gz', 'os_loganalyze/tests/test_filters.py', 'os_loganalyze/tests/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Match ansible output for console

If you look at console.html output with the zuul/ansible launchers in
a web-browser, you get weird coloring of the lines.  For example a
line like

 2016-06-17 03:19:47.803531 INFO:zuul.Cloner:Loaded map containing 1 rules

starts everything looking "blue" (for info) after it.

The problem is that the above line looks enough like an olso line that
the oslo formatting-regex picks it up and sets the "info" status,
which persists until it happens to match another line that alters the
status.  Previously, Jenkins would prepend these lines with
"timestamp | ..."  which prevented these matches.

To avoid this problem, but not affect matching for thinks like
devstacklog, add a more specific match for the ansible timestamp
format and match on that first.  A test-case is added.

Change-Id: Icfd9ff3d8d42abc7276b2aaa4021ddb1a82c3630
'}]
commit_message:
Match ansible output for console

If you look at console.html output with the zuul/ansible launchers in
a web-browser, you get weird coloring of the lines.  For example a
line like

 2016-06-17 03:19:47.803531 INFO:zuul.Cloner:Loaded map containing 1 rules

starts everything looking "blue" (for info) after it.

The problem is that the above line looks enough like an olso line that
the oslo formatting-regex picks it up and sets the "info" status,
which persists until it happens to match another line that alters the
status.  Previously, Jenkins would prepend these lines with
"timestamp | ..."  which prevented these matches.

To avoid this problem, but not affect matching for thinks like
devstacklog, add a more specific match for the ansible timestamp
format and match on that first.  A test-case is added.

Change-Id: Icfd9ff3d8d42abc7276b2aaa4021ddb1a82c3630

subject: Fix keystone-coverage-db gate for stable/liberty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 18:56:33.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fix keystone-coverage-db gate for stable/liberty

keystone-coverage-db gate is currently broken for stable/liberty
branch because it is using dogpile.cache version 0.6.1 which
breaks some tests in keystone.tests.unit.test_cache_backend_mongo
as seen here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332975/1.

We need to put an upper limit to the version of dogpile.cache to
version 0.5.7 which is the one used previously by this gate and
which was working successfully.

Change-Id: I2e2bcb76e4a20894cf8d799cd5718e9a7fc5646f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone-coverage-db gate for stable/liberty

keystone-coverage-db gate is currently broken for stable/liberty
branch because it is using dogpile.cache version 0.6.1 which
breaks some tests in keystone.tests.unit.test_cache_backend_mongo
as seen here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332975/1.

We need to put an upper limit to the version of dogpile.cache to
version 0.5.7 which is the one used previously by this gate and
which was working successfully.

Change-Id: I2e2bcb76e4a20894cf8d799cd5718e9a7fc5646f

commit_message:
/services?name=<name> API fails when using list_limit

When using list_limit configuration option in Default section of
keystone.conf, the /services?name=<service_name> API fails to find
the service if list_limit value is smaller than the total number
of services and the searched service is not among the first
'list_limit' services. The API should first filter by name and
only afterwards truncate the result list.

Also, this patch fixes setting the 'truncated' attribute of the
driver's hint.limit object when truncating the list outside of
driver_hints.truncated decorator, problem exposed by fixing the
problem described in the first paragraph.

Closes-Bug: #1594482
(cherry picked from commit 6a9a9f002f44c15d40cf890eefd03a4ab6172b0b)
Conflicts:

commit_message:
Use DummyYaqlYamlLoader to load classes during upload

This commit changes the loader, that loads MuranoPL classes during
package upload to DummyYaqlYamlLoader. This would allow importing and parsing
packages that contain '!yaql' tag without any errors, when importing to
glare.

Change-Id: I9071bb479019cac20bf61f110154082063c9d777
Closes-Bug: #1586028

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 04:44:04.000000000', 'files': ['go/objectserver/replicator_test.go'], 'message': 'Patch through the error from NewReplicator

Normally this is pointless, because we test NewReplicator by
itself and we know that it works. However, if anything goes
pear shaped in the environment, like swift.conf is missing,
we want to know what it is, rather than guess.

Change-Id: I9488bd16dafc1b16d034bea963e4502c06988452

commit_message:
Patch through the error from NewReplicator

Normally this is pointless, because we test NewReplicator by
itself and we know that it works. However, if anything goes
pear shaped in the environment, like swift.conf is missing,
we want to know what it is, rather than guess.

Change-Id: I9488bd16dafc1b16d034bea963e4502c06988452

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-21 18:58:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': "remove support for legacy v2 generator extensions

This removes the support for legacy v2 extensions which were allowed
to be generators to have a pre / post processing phase. The modern
compute api stack never supported this construct.

Because of the remove of the 'pre' phase, the 'post_process' phase is
just renamed to 'process'.

All pre_process and generator tests are removed.

Change-Id: Ia34c1f814fb938915d74c6845dfa5135cba29d0a
"}]
commit_message:
remove support for legacy v2 generator extensions

This removes the support for legacy v2 extensions which were allowed
to be generators to have a pre / post processing phase. The modern
compute api stack never supported this construct.

Because of the remove of the 'pre' phase, the 'post_process' phase is
just renamed to 'process'.

All pre_process and generator tests are removed.

Change-Id: Ia34c1f814fb938915d74c6845dfa5135cba29d0a

commit_message:
Add Trustee User and Domain Creation

Magnum requires a specialized user and domain created
in order to own the stacks created for bays.  This patch
ensures that the trustee domain and user are created,
and that the appropriate configuration entries are placed into
magnum.conf

Change-Id: I0bb351d6cd60217d7c79cb44ca895681e01c8407

subject: Support JSON data for port binding profile
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 20:43:36.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/command-objects/port.rst', 'openstackclient/tests/network/v2/test_port.py', 'openstackclient/network/v2/port.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-neutron-client-a0552f8ca909b665.yaml'], 'message': 'Support JSON data for port binding profile

Update the "--binding-profile" option on the "port create" and
"port set" commands to support both <key>=<value> and JSON input
for the port custom binding profile data. The JSON input is
sometimes needed to maintain the value type (e.g. integer) for
more advanced data.

The port custom binding profile data is unique across neutron
so a custom argparse.Action class was created instead of
writting a generic class in osc-lib.

Change-Id: I82ac6d4f95afdc866f5282fc00d390f850f54d21
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
'}]
commit_message:
Support JSON data for port binding profile

Update the "--binding-profile" option on the "port create" and
"port set" commands to support both <key>=<value> and JSON input
for the port custom binding profile data. The JSON input is
sometimes needed to maintain the value type (e.g. integer) for
more advanced data.

The port custom binding profile data is unique across neutron
so a custom argparse.Action class was created instead of
writting a generic class in osc-lib.

Change-Id: I82ac6d4f95afdc866f5282fc00d390f850f54d21
Implements: blueprint neutron-client

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-21 12:18:46.000000000', 'files': ['hadoop-swiftfs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/swift/http/SwiftRestClient.java', 'hadoop-swiftfs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/swift/http/SwiftProtocolConstants.java', 'hadoop-swiftfs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/swift/http/RestClientBindings.java'], 'message': 'hadoop-swiftfs: Allow configuring container.tenant

Implements the possibility to manipulate the storage URL
to specify the AUTH_tenant, when accessing containers
that are shared across different tenants

https://swiftstack.com/docs/cookbooks/swift_usage/auth.html

Sample config snippet:

<property>
  <name>fs.swift.service.sahara.auth.endpoint.prefix</name>
  <value>/v1/AUTH_</value>
</property>
<property>
  <name>fs.swift.service.sahara.container.tenant</name>
  <value>uuid</value>
</property>

Change-Id: Ifc349fe1fca9637e62ac05c8422887d6a51371d4
'}]
commit_message:
hadoop-swiftfs: Allow configuring container.tenant

Implements the possibility to manipulate the storage URL
to specify the AUTH_tenant, when accessing containers
that are shared across different tenants

https://swiftstack.com/docs/cookbooks/swift_usage/auth.html

Sample config snippet:

<property>
  <name>fs.swift.service.sahara.auth.endpoint.prefix</name>
  <value>/v1/AUTH_</value>
</property>
<property>
  <name>fs.swift.service.sahara.container.tenant</name>
  <value>uuid</value>
</property>

Change-Id: Ifc349fe1fca9637e62ac05c8422887d6a51371d4

subject: Improve masking of secrets in configuration show
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-21 06:56:23.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/common/test_configuration.py', 'openstackclient/common/configuration.py'], 'message': 'Improve masking of secrets in configuration show

The command "configuration show" tries to redact some of the secrets
that are shown on the screen. However, this failed redacting options
that were marked as secrete by the auth plugins (if any) and it redacted
other options that were not redacted at all. For example, when using
the OpenID Connect plugins, it redacted the "access_token_endpoint" as
the word "token" appears there, but it failed to redact "client_secret"
even when this option is marked as secret in the corresponding plugin.

Change-Id: Idfad4fbbe5ddcff5e729e1dcd756d0379ad31dee
'}]
commit_message:
Improve masking of secrets in configuration show

The command "configuration show" tries to redact some of the secrets
that are shown on the screen. However, this failed redacting options
that were marked as secrete by the auth plugins (if any) and it redacted
other options that were not redacted at all. For example, when using
the OpenID Connect plugins, it redacted the "access_token_endpoint" as
the word "token" appears there, but it failed to redact "client_secret"
even when this option is marked as secret in the corresponding plugin.

Change-Id: Idfad4fbbe5ddcff5e729e1dcd756d0379ad31dee

subject: Add another 'fault' flavor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-16 04:23:12.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/conf/test_begin.conf', 'scripts/redstack'], 'message': "Add another 'fault' flavor

Apparently there are two code paths for a failure
creating a Nova instance. One returns immediatesly
and the other takes some time to fail.  The case
where the initial command to Nova succeeds only
to fail later needs another flavor to test it.

A new flavor with not enough disk to install the
Trove image has been created to test this scenarion.

Change-Id: I5d3339e9cbfd6aeb0c3ff6936fefa8dbe9e841f8
"}]
commit_message:
Add another 'fault' flavor

Apparently there are two code paths for a failure
creating a Nova instance. One returns immediatesly
and the other takes some time to fail.  The case
where the initial command to Nova succeeds only
to fail later needs another flavor to test it.

A new flavor with not enough disk to install the
Trove image has been created to test this scenarion.

Change-Id: I5d3339e9cbfd6aeb0c3ff6936fefa8dbe9e841f8

Explicit Teardown

  - all to teardown all

  - nodes to teardown only nodes

commit_message:
use env vars to specify OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION

If the default identity API version were to change
in devstack, the v2.0 tests would fail today,
resulting in a broken OSC gate.

commit_message:
Add support for microversion 2.30

Now the os-migrateLive API supports a new body argument called 'force' which
helps the operators to bypass the scheduler call in case they provide a host.

Also modifies the host_evacuate_live helper method in the contrib tree to make
sure operators also have the force flag in case they need it for a global call.

Change-Id: Id7fcd88ad060390ac6d1a21510d84363ed643957
Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton

Now the os-evacuate API supports a new body argument called 'force' which
helps the operators to bypass the scheduler call in case they provide a host.

Also modifies the host_evacuate helper method in the contrib tree to make sure
operators also have the force flag in case they need it for a global call.

Change-Id: I5272e9809a7d8be482e87548c6a3b11186c5d1e1
Partially-Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for microversion 2.29

Now the os-evacuate API supports a new body argument called 'force' which
helps the operators to bypass the scheduler call in case they provide a host.

Also modifies the host_evacuate helper method in the contrib tree to make sure
operators also have the force flag in case they need it for a global call.

Change-Id: I5272e9809a7d8be482e87548c6a3b11186c5d1e1
Partially-Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-23 00:25:45.000000000', 'files': ['copy_logs.sh'], 'message': 'Don't hardcode user:group ownership after the "jenkins" name

This will prevent permissions setting from failing when run under
another user which can be expected when running in other
environments or as openstack-infra phases out jenkins.

Change-Id: Id4cf39e2d4fd21604d359eb6ce6a3716b6bba931

commit_message:
Don't hardcode user:group ownership after the "jenkins" name

This will prevent permissions setting from failing when run under
another user which can be expected when running in other
environments or as openstack-infra phases out jenkins.

Change-Id: Id4cf39e2d4fd21604d359eb6ce6a3716b6bba931
Depends-On: I58f6ee3ce22a3826fadfb019d3c67be710ab95d7

revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2016-06-17 19:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/utils.py', 'kuryr/tests/fullstack/test_container.py'], 'message': 'Allowing ip operations in fullstack test

This patch is to discuss how we allow Kuryr to operate for
the fullstack tests we are adding and require creating
containers and associating them with Kuryr networks. This
requires binding and executing ipdb operations for creating
interfaces, etc. As of now, these operations fail.

Change-Id: Ie7c435c00746a2e89c7c06435e96abaa24c6ddf4
'}]
commit_message:
Allowing ip operations in fullstack test

This patch is to discuss how we allow Kuryr to operate for
the fullstack tests we are adding and require creating
containers and associating them with Kuryr networks. This
requires binding and executing ipdb operations for creating
interfaces, etc. As of now, these operations fail.

Change-Id: Ie7c435c00746a2e89c7c06435e96abaa24c6ddf4

subject: Consolidate service_providers into neutron server
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7604, 'name': 'Sergey Kolekonov', 'email': 'skolekonov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'skolekonov'}, {'_account_id': 7732, 'name': 'IvanBerezovskiy', 'email': 'ivan.berezovskii@gmail.com', 'username': 'iberezovskiy'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 8318, 'name': 'Matthew J Black', 'email': 'mjblack@gmail.com', 'username': 'mjblack'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16312, 'name': 'Alfredo Moralejo', 'email': 'amoralej@redhat.com', 'username': 'amoralej'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-22 18:20:24.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/services/vpnaas.pp', 'spec/acceptance/basic_neutron_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_config/openstackconfig.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/consolidate_service_provider_configuration-3ce48947a396ad25.yaml', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_config/ini_setting.rb', 'manifests/services/lbaas.pp', 'spec/classes/neutron_server_spec.rb', 'spec/acceptance/neutron_config_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/neutron_config.rb', 'manifests/server.pp', 'spec/unit/type/neutron_config_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Consolidate service_providers into neutron server

The configuration of vpnaas and lbaas services created
additional files that were never included in the service
startup. The lbaas service config provider was updated
to put service providers directly into neutron.conf
but now if we update vpnaas to do the same we will fail
being idempotent since both providers will overwrite
each other. This change moves neutron_config provider from
ini_setting to openstackconfig to handle the multi-value
of service_provider and adds a variable to neutron::server
to manage service providers.

Closes-Bug: 1578912
Change-Id: I69b7635984fe74038db2025b89f638def5029849
(cherry picked from commit f77ef0ec6530686e7b6ba5adc2a5091fe07a9428)
'}]
commit_message:
Consolidate service_providers into neutron server

The configuration of vpnaas and lbaas services created
additional files that were never included in the service
startup. The lbaas service config provider was updated
to put service providers directly into neutron.conf
but now if we update vpnaas to do the same we will fail
being idempotent since both providers will overwrite
each other. This change moves neutron_config provider from
ini_setting to openstackconfig to handle the multi-value
of service_provider and adds a variable to neutron::server
to manage service providers.

Closes-Bug: 1578912
Change-Id: I69b7635984fe74038db2025b89f638def5029849
(cherry picked from commit f77ef0ec6530686e7b6ba5adc2a5091fe07a9428)

commit_message:
Volume manage/unmanage support for Eqlx driver

This change will allow cinder to manage existing
volumes on Dell PS Series(Equallogic) backend and also
unmanage them.

DocImpact

subject: Replace print statment with print function
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-23 04:09:12.000000000', 'files': ['tools/install_venv_common.py', 'tools/install_venv.py'], 'message': 'Replace print statment with print function

In PY3, print should used as a function instead of a statement.
This is PY27 compatible as well.

For example, instances of the first case were replaced by the
second case:

>>> print 'help'
  File "<stdin>", line 1
    print 'help'
               ^
SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'

>>> print('help')
help

Change-Id: I247aedf4a3090c2d75338389cf383adb090da231
Closes-bug: #1594741
'}]
commit_message:
Replace print statment with print function

In PY3, print should used as a function instead of a statement.
This is PY27 compatible as well.

For example, instances of the first case were replaced by the
second case:

>>> print 'help'
  File "<stdin>", line 1
    print 'help'
               ^
SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'

>>> print('help')
help

Change-Id: I247aedf4a3090c2d75338389cf383adb090da231
Closes-bug: #1594741

revisions:
[{'number': 94, 'created': '2016-06-23 15:50:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo/versions/105_add_password_date_columns.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql_model.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py'], 'message': 'PCI-DSS Password SQL model changes

This patch creates new password table columns and updates the password
properties to allow for multiple passwords in order to support:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.4: Change user passwords/passphrases at least once every
90 days.

* PCI-DSS 8.2.5: Do not allow an individual to submit a new
password/phrase that is the same as any of the last four
passwords/phrases he or she has used.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: Ib515b0d8e56a74bb8eb12baa79c8bc133fa5d809
'}]
commit_message:
PCI-DSS Password SQL model changes

This patch creates new password table columns and updates the password
properties to allow for multiple passwords in order to support:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.4: Change user passwords/passphrases at least once every
90 days.

* PCI-DSS 8.2.5: Do not allow an individual to submit a new
password/phrase that is the same as any of the last four
passwords/phrases he or she has used.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: Ib515b0d8e56a74bb8eb12baa79c8bc133fa5d809

commit_message:
Add support to both v2 and v3 auth_urls

This patch adds support to authenticate all datasource drivers
using both v2 and v3 auth_urls. Also made change in devstack

commit_message:
add sphinx-argparse to global requirements

This library with extention that can be used for creating autogenerated
documention for CLI. Additionally,

1. any new contribution are welcome per contrib page in
   readthedocs [0], by the way there is no commits since middle of
   2015;
2. library have good enough code, which have proof of correct preparing
   autogenerated docs of CLI in python-saharaclient
3. no offical support of python3, but it works at least for
   saharaclient case, and also there is python3 package in
   ubuntu for latest version [2];
4. MIT licensed;
5. Packaged for Ubuntu ([2], [3]). For Fedora case there is a [4]
6. Can used by all openstackclient plugins and openstackclient as well,
   saharaclient is also supposed to be user of this library.

[0] https://sphinx-argparse.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contrib.html
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-saharaclient/cli.html
[2] http://packages.ubuntu.com/xenial/python3-sphinx-argparse
[3] http://packages.ubuntu.com/xenial/python-sphinx-argparse
[4] https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/python-sphinx-argparse

Change-Id: I7cb7e0e33fb3f674003a656652b79ed47ff7b000

Skip test suite on 32-bit platforms

There are some known mismatches (1024 vs 1024L) in the testsuite
for 32bit platforms, and since it is not tested upstream either
let's just skip it until it got fixed.

devstack: Change MidoNet deb repository URL

subject: Added a muranoPL-specific override of 'call'
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-06-23 15:19:40.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_call.py', 'murano/dsl/yaql_functions.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/TestCall.yaml'], 'message': "Added a muranoPL-specific override of 'call'

Yaql's standard system function 'call' was not working properly in
MuranoPL because murano relies on object-specific context containing
definitions of the methods of appropriate class.

This patch adds a MuranoPL-specific override of this function which
creates an appropriate method-invocation AST and executes it. This
will invoke regular muranoPl's override of operator_. thus causing all
the appropriate type and object contexts to be created for the call.

Closes-bug: #1595174

Change-Id: If3e98a60063b0843c317fa565616c8d88f9e497c
"}]
commit_message:
Added a muranoPL-specific override of 'call'

Yaql's standard system function 'call' was not working properly in
MuranoPL because murano relies on object-specific context containing
definitions of the methods of appropriate class.

This patch adds a MuranoPL-specific override of this function which
creates an appropriate method-invocation AST and executes it. This
will invoke regular muranoPl's override of operator_. thus causing all
the appropriate type and object contexts to be created for the call.

Closes-bug: #1595174

Change-Id: If3e98a60063b0843c317fa565616c8d88f9e497c

commit_message:
Update dhcp_opts on both create and update

The dhcp_opts come from the virt driver, so longer term will always
happen only in the port update. During this transition, for now we just
make sure we always send the dhcp_opts for both create and update.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling

Change-Id: Ib58167152d8fc81f9272f2aca56ce493f72eb43d

commit_message:
Add install-{obs, rdo, ubuntu}.rst files

Add install-obs.rst, install-rdo.rst and install-ubuntu.rst
for distro installations beacause the doc infrastructure is
not set up to support conditional content.

Factor out database setup, creation of service, creation of
endpoints and service configuration.

Partially-Implements: blueprint projectspecificinstallguides
Change-Id: I064181f512961516c7c50844d04f1ad27eda928d

commit_message:
Inherit custom yaml Loader from yaml.SafeLoader

Before this patch yaql-enabled yaml Loader was inherited from yaml.Loader, that
potentially allows creating arbitrary python objects from specifically
formatted yaml tags. This could have happened whenever UI definitions of
the package were processed.
With this change yaql yaml-Loader no longer allows creating custom python objects.

Change-Id: I4fe38aa7e0fc567211ab872c7e1f8e81dbc3e765
Closes-Bug: #1586079

subject: Use yaml.SafeLoader instead of yaml.Loader
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 15:46:58.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/common/utils.py', 'muranoclient/v1/package_creator/hot_package.py', 'muranoclient/v1/artifact_packages.py', 'muranoclient/v1/packages.py', 'releasenotes/notes/safeloader-cve-2016-4972-0631d83f3f5c0186.yaml'], 'message': 'Use yaml.SafeLoader instead of yaml.Loader

Before this patch yaml.Loader was used by the client to create custom
yaql-enabled yaml loader. It is unsfae do to so, because yaml.Loader is
capable of creating custom python objects from specifically constructed
yaml files.
UI parsing functions also fell back to yaml.Loader if
the custom loader was not supplied.
After this patch all yaml load operations are performed with safe
loaders instead.

Change-Id: Id9bb6eabda35522271ec394f8758a974878cbb4b
Closes-Bug: #1586078
'}]
commit_message:
Use yaml.SafeLoader instead of yaml.Loader

Before this patch yaml.Loader was used by the client to create custom
yaql-enabled yaml loader. It is unsfae do to so, because yaml.Loader is
capable of creating custom python objects from specifically constructed
yaml files.
UI parsing functions also fell back to yaml.Loader if
the custom loader was not supplied.
After this patch all yaml load operations are performed with safe
loaders instead.

Change-Id: Id9bb6eabda35522271ec394f8758a974878cbb4b
Closes-Bug: #1586078

The 'domain_id' and 'name' unique constraint was not properly dropped
in some cases because the unique constraint was not consistently
named. In all cases we must search for the constraint expected,
not assume the name of the constraint will be consistent
(especially from older installs that have been moved forward in
releases). This fix is modeled on the fix for a similair issue
authored by Morgan Fainberg & Matthew Thode for Bug #1562934

Migration 091:
    Fix to broken migration to prevent failed migrations when database is
    upgraded from Kilo (or below) to Mitaka
Migration 097:
    Ensure that when Mitaka point release is applied the constraint and tables
    have been dropped if migration 91 was previously worked around.

Migration 91 drops 3 columns from the user table after the code to disable
the constraint. I have included code in migrations 97 to also drop
those columns if they are still present in case they were missed when working
around Bug #1572341. This may be over kill.

The following file conflicted since Opportunistic DB testing was included
in the Newton release.

  keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py

Change-Id: I076d7139b388e30be8826d0a4550256b5617d992
Closes-bug: #1572341
"}]
commit_message:
Correct domain_id and name constraint dropping

The 'domain_id' and 'name' unique constraint was not properly dropped
in some cases because the unique constraint was not consistently
named. In all cases we must search for the constraint expected,
not assume the name of the constraint will be consistent
(especially from older installs that have been moved forward in
releases). This fix is modeled on the fix for a similair issue
authored by Morgan Fainberg & Matthew Thode for Bug #1562934

Migration 091:
    Fix to broken migration to prevent failed migrations when database is
    upgraded from Kilo (or below) to Mitaka
Migration 097:
    Ensure that when Mitaka point release is applied the constraint and tables
    have been dropped if migration 91 was previously worked around.

Migration 91 drops 3 columns from the user table after the code to disable
the constraint. I have included code in migrations 97 to also drop
those columns if they are still present in case they were missed when working
around Bug #1572341. This may be over kill.

The following file conflicted since Opportunistic DB testing was included
in the Newton release.

  keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py

Note that migration 104 was removed since it does not exist in the Mitaka
release. The unit tests were also modified accordingly.

Change-Id: I076d7139b388e30be8826d0a4550256b5617d992
Closes-bug: #1572341

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-06-21 12:40:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': 'Add ironic mac address when updating and creating

We should ensure we add a mac_address from the pool of available
addresses (for ironic) both when the user has already created a port and
when Nova is creating a port for the user.

This patch includes catching the MacAddressInUseClient exception when
updating a port that has possibly updated the mac. This is to match the
behavior when we call create_port.

The data for  mac addresses comes from the virt driver, so eventually
this will only happen during port update. As a first step we move it to
be called during both create and update paths.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling

Change-Id: I536f65186aa21255dee9b1b784f1e7b1324c5cbe
'}]
commit_message:
Add ironic mac address when updating and creating

We should ensure we add a mac_address from the pool of available
addresses (for ironic) both when the user has already created a port and
when Nova is creating a port for the user.

This patch includes catching the MacAddressInUseClient exception when
updating a port that has possibly updated the mac. This is to match the
behavior when we call create_port.

The data for  mac addresses comes from the virt driver, so eventually
this will only happen during port update. As a first step we move it to
be called during both create and update paths.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling

Change-Id: I536f65186aa21255dee9b1b784f1e7b1324c5cbe

commit_message:
Remove network-id from tap-service

Currently it's unused.  Thus no good reason to force users to
specify it.

It can be re-introduced when/if we decide automatic port creation
is desirable.  For db models, a boolean to say if the port has been
automatically created might be more appropriate, though.

Change-Id: Ia183635c183fd4ad731fd1ee48c58f6b10f06c5b

before clicking it (by means of setting a CSS class after that
timeout, which test in turn waits before clicking the dropdown).

Closes-Bug: #1594926
Change-Id: I32625caa4433f4af0de72c94b61e85ab4e16b1f9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dropdowns sometimes not opening in integration tests

Since most probable cause of dropdowns not opening intermittently is
Bootstrap initialization code not having enough time to complete
before test tries to open dropdown, make test wait a specified timeout
before clicking it (by means of setting a CSS class after that
timeout, which test in turn waits before clicking the dropdown).

Closes-Bug: #1594926
Change-Id: I32625caa4433f4af0de72c94b61e85ab4e16b1f9

commit_message:
Inherit custom yaml Loader from yaml.SafeLoader

Before this patch yaql-enabled yaml Loader was inherited from yaml.Loader, that
potentially allows creating arbitrary python objects from specifically
formatted yaml tags. This could have happened whenever UI definitions of
the package were processed.
With this change yaql yaml-Loader no longer allows creating custom python objects.

Change-Id: I4fe38aa7e0fc567211ab872c7e1f8e81dbc3e765
Closes-Bug: #1586079

commit_message:
Use SafeLoader to load yaml files

Before this patch yaml.Loader was used by the engine to create custom
yaql-enabled yaml loader. It is unsafe do to so, because yaml.Loader is
capable of creating custom python objects from specifically constructed
yaml files.
After this patch all yaml load operations are performed with safe
loaders instead.
Also use SafeConstructor instead of Constructor.

Change-Id: I61a3c42d73608b5d013285f015a45f4774d264e3
Closes-Bug: #1586079

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-06-23 04:55:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/identity/v3/test_domain.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1561599-d5f541f08ae6274a.yaml', 'openstackclient/tests/identity/v3/test_user.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/project.py', 'openstackclient/tests/identity/v3/fakes.py', 'openstackclient/tests/identity/v3/test_project.py', 'openstackclient/identity/common.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/user.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/domain.py'], 'message': 'Use resource id when name given for identity show

Currently a user is allowed to specify either a resource ID or name
when running openstack identity comands. In some cases, when a name
is specified instead of an ID, the command will return as not able
to find the resource when it in fact does exist.

The changes here are to check the client against the token on such
requests and to extract the ID of the resource specified if enough
information exists between the two. We then use the ID associated
with the resource to complete the user requests.

Change-Id: I40713b0ded42063b786dc21247e854224b9d2fe2
Closes-Bug: #1561599
'}]
commit_message:
Use resource id when name given for identity show

Currently a user is allowed to specify either a resource ID or name
when running openstack identity comands. In some cases, when a name
is specified instead of an ID, the command will return as not able
to find the resource when it in fact does exist.

The changes here are to check the client against the token on such
requests and to extract the ID of the resource specified if enough
information exists between the two. We then use the ID associated
with the resource to complete the user requests.

Change-Id: I40713b0ded42063b786dc21247e854224b9d2fe2
Closes-Bug: #1561599

subject: fix post-version parsing to allow the trailing git sha
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-09 00:04:34.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_version.py', 'pbr/version.py'], 'message': 'fix post-version parsing to allow the trailing git sha

Fix the parser to support versions like 1.2.0.post47.gabcdef where the
last component is 'g' followed by a hex value representing a git hash
prefix.

Also add a test demonstrating that this form already works if the "post"
is left out, as in 1.2.0.47.gabcdef.

Change-Id: Iba555d1eb8c791fdcbe82fbbdbe1d6e15b720ca3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix post-version parsing to allow the trailing git sha

Fix the parser to support versions like 1.2.0.post47.gabcdef where the
last component is 'g' followed by a hex value representing a git hash
prefix.

Also add a test demonstrating that this form already works if the "post"
is left out, as in 1.2.0.47.gabcdef.

Change-Id: Iba555d1eb8c791fdcbe82fbbdbe1d6e15b720ca3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: PEP8 tests failing with E211 error
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-22 10:22:51.000000000', 'files': ['toscaparser/shell.py'], 'message': "PEP8 tests failing with E211 error

 From Py2.x to Py3.x entity of reserved name 'print' changed
 in Py3.x it became a function, so shell.py with running tox tests with
 base python 3.x fails to pass those checks because it is necessary
 to avoid whitespace between function name and its parameters
 declaration.
 
 This patch fixes every 'print' call to avoid whitespace between
 function name and its parameters

Change-Id: Ibdb577b08c8cc775b45fe670ec9db1d3f62cdc79
"}]
commit_message:
PEP8 tests failing with E211 error

 From Py2.x to Py3.x entity of reserved name 'print' changed
 in Py3.x it became a function, so shell.py with running tox tests with
 base python 3.x fails to pass those checks because it is necessary
 to avoid whitespace between function name and its parameters
 declaration.
 
 This patch fixes every 'print' call to avoid whitespace between
 function name and its parameters

Change-Id: Ibdb577b08c8cc775b45fe670ec9db1d3f62cdc79

commit_message:
Deployment vmedia operations to run when cleaning

The virtual media operations in task.driver.boot.prepare_ramdisk()
should be performed while the provision state of the node is
in 'cleaning'.

Change-Id: I4f563586523ea6e4a5a630c5fe44f70fe473bdf8
Closes-Bug: #1570283

subject: Clean floating IPs on tripleo-test-cloud-rh1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 15:15:57.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': "Clean floating IPs on tripleo-test-cloud-rh1

Now that nodepool supports optionally cleaning leaked floating IPs,
let's enable it on tripleo-test-cloud-rh1 cloud.

We're having some issues where sometimes jobs don't get run successfuly
because no more floating IP is available.

Change-Id: Icd0130486610c404ae4dacb3d4e79956ae07daac
"}]
commit_message:
Clean floating IPs on tripleo-test-cloud-rh1

Now that nodepool supports optionally cleaning leaked floating IPs,
let's enable it on tripleo-test-cloud-rh1 cloud.

We're having some issues where sometimes jobs don't get run successfuly
because no more floating IP is available.

Change-Id: Icd0130486610c404ae4dacb3d4e79956ae07daac

commit_message:
remove extra quota commit of manage snapshot

When manage an existing snapshot of a volume, cinder-api and cinder-vol
both commit quota. This result in an extra commit.This change remove
the extra commit in the cinder-api.

Closes-bug: #1562830
(cherry picked from commit 9809769707352e756575b02a4520248b18c8559b)

Change-Id: Ic93ceebfcd9703549eb5f6b41e404a36ce24daae

commit_message:
Clean floating IPs on tripleo-test-cloud-rh2

Now that nodepool supports optionally cleaning leaked floating IPs,
let's enable it on tripleo-test-cloud-rh2 cloud.

We're having some issues where sometimes jobs don't get run successfuly
because no more floating IP is available.

Change-Id: I628cc8e4aa3ae1544f63af46bf2c6b32318a126b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-21 18:09:02.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'devstack/plugin.sh: use screen_stop

A custom, direct screen call is being used to stop inspector
processes.  This breaks grenade testing for me as no screen is used in
that environment.

This patch suggests adopting screen_stop instead.  See also project
devstack/functions-common:screen_stop

Change-Id: I63d0c7400ecdff4333ffc31b6607d94f8cf20e18
(cherry picked from commit 33dea6b3815409b8a2342f954b662b0f888e70ff)
'}]
commit_message:
devstack/plugin.sh: use screen_stop

A custom, direct screen call is being used to stop inspector
processes.  This breaks grenade testing for me as no screen is used in
that environment.

This patch suggests adopting screen_stop instead.  See also project
devstack/functions-common:screen_stop

Change-Id: I63d0c7400ecdff4333ffc31b6607d94f8cf20e18
(cherry picked from commit 33dea6b3815409b8a2342f954b662b0f888e70ff)

commit_message:
Fix libvirt node revert and resume

- is_active check removed from resume
- destroy() is not required in case of basic snapshot
- is_active return valuet converted to bool

Change-Id: I0e220de8665ae3b2a6a2d0b576e1a761d8c232d7
Closes-Bug: #1591094

subject: Fix errors for "host set" command
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-06-22 06:22:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/fakes.py', 'openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_host.py', 'doc/source/command-objects/host.rst', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/host.py'], 'message': 'Fix errors for "host set" command

"Host set" command cannot work. Because:
1.Host has no 'ID' attribute, so 'ID' attribute cannot be found
in "host set" command.
2.value "True" and "Flase" are invalid in updata() method of host.
3.Some update functionalities is not supported in host API now.

This patch solves the problems 1 and 2 in OSC. But the problem 3
is a API problem and can't be solved in OSC, only XenServer driver
support to set enable/disable and maintenance host, it is a normal
problem.
After this patch the output of "host set" command is:
The requested functionality is not supported. (HTTP 501)
(Request-ID: req-14031fce-8c90-48a0-8492-dc8e3dd349f3)
Just the same as the "host-update" command in novaclient.

Change-Id: Ibe94c4d3d492d3d63355de803810edb988e1b4e9
Closes-Bug: #1594689
'}]
commit_message:
Fix errors for "host set" command

"Host set" command cannot work. Because:
1.Host has no 'ID' attribute, so 'ID' attribute cannot be found
in "host set" command.
2.value "True" and "Flase" are invalid in updata() method of host.
3.Some update functionalities is not supported in host API now.

This patch solves the problems 1 and 2 in OSC. But the problem 3
is a API problem and can't be solved in OSC, only XenServer driver
support to set enable/disable and maintenance host, it is a normal
problem.
After this patch the output of "host set" command is:
The requested functionality is not supported. (HTTP 501)
(Request-ID: req-14031fce-8c90-48a0-8492-dc8e3dd349f3)
Just the same as the "host-update" command in novaclient.

Change-Id: Ibe94c4d3d492d3d63355de803810edb988e1b4e9
Closes-Bug: #1594689

subject: Replace MySQL-Python with PyMySQL
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-23 13:16:21.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/manual_install.rst', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py', 'requirements.txt', 'trove/tests/db/migrations.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbmodels.py'], 'message': "Replace MySQL-Python with PyMySQL

MySQL-Python is more maintained since January 2014 and doesn't
support Python 3. Replace it with PyMySQL which is actively
developped and works on Python 2 and Python 3. Since PyMySQL is
written in pure Python, it can be monkey-patched by eventlet to avoid
blocking.

MySQL-Python support is kept, but PyMySQL is now used by default.

More information:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3
Change-Id: I73769bd9eb24e459dd439295223e3fee72506841
"}]
commit_message:
Replace MySQL-Python with PyMySQL

MySQL-Python is more maintained since January 2014 and doesn't
support Python 3. Replace it with PyMySQL which is actively
developped and works on Python 2 and Python 3. Since PyMySQL is
written in pure Python, it can be monkey-patched by eventlet to avoid
blocking.

MySQL-Python support is kept, but PyMySQL is now used by default.

More information:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3
Change-Id: I73769bd9eb24e459dd439295223e3fee72506841

commit_message:
Bump requests-mock to 1.0

Requests-mock 1.0 provides additional information on requests such as
the certificates and timeouts used when performing a request that will
simplify some client and keystoneauth1 testing.

1.0 is the version following 0.7. There is no breaking change to the API
so there are no compatibility issues here.

Change-Id: I125b283f899f39196776d18a0201eff8256954a8

As a equivalent of the mox.ContainsKeyValue() function
from the legacy mox library, a new class ContainsKeyValue
is added which is a helper for use with the mock.assert_called_with() method
that lets you assert that a particular parameter
has a specific key/value pair.

Change-Id: I59471e6ee51cd46de3322678cb3496d259a19e45
Partial-BP: remove-mox-newton
'}]
commit_message:
Replace mox.ContainsKeyValue with Class ContainsKeyValue

As a equivalent of the mox.ContainsKeyValue() function
from the legacy mox library, a new class ContainsKeyValue
is added which is a helper for use with the mock.assert_called_with() method
that lets you assert that a particular parameter
has a specific key/value pair.

Change-Id: I59471e6ee51cd46de3322678cb3496d259a19e45
Partial-BP: remove-mox-newton

commit_message:
Add require-all=false to aodh upgrade constraint

We missed that the variable redis_aodh_constraint_params
was undefined in the upgrade path for aodh.
Make sure it is defined by mimicking the same approach
used in the pacemaker overcloud manifest.

Change-Id: I3b5412cde7e41ca4c277c7364ca9a9a34814c449
Fixes-bug: #1595158

subject: move release var from positional to an argument
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-22 21:43:33.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/basic.sh', 'ci-scripts/roles-deploy.sh', 'ci-scripts/feature-scale-deploy.sh', 'ci-scripts/images.sh', 'quickstart.sh', 'README.md', 'ci-scripts/full-deploy.sh'], 'message': "move release var from positional to an argument

* use -r for requirements
* use -R for the tripleo release

Style change, change the release variable from a positional
argument to flag argument.  Having just one positional argument
may make things more fool proof as you can't mix up the virthost
and release order this way.

Change-Id: I1517a6be4eb2452423a2a6edc49473d69b6f8065
"}]
commit_message:
move release var from positional to an argument

* use -r for requirements
* use -R for the tripleo release

Style change, change the release variable from a positional
argument to flag argument.  Having just one positional argument
may make things more fool proof as you can't mix up the virthost
and release order this way.

Change-Id: I1517a6be4eb2452423a2a6edc49473d69b6f8065

commit_message:
Create common neutron module

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 14:36:58.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "puppet: xenial jobs are now -nv

Because:
* we're having unknown issues with Zuul and Ansible (async), a lot of
  jobs are randomly failing.
* we're having random failures in Tempest tests when using Newton
  packaging from Ubuntu.

Things are unstable now. Hopefully we have more stable jobs with CentOS7
that allow us to keep jobs in gate to actually do testing.
Until we have the same situation for Ubuntu, let's make them non-voting.

Revert this patch once things get better.

Change-Id: I728692038b3b9700c09d37ce6e5c3c4716517df0
"}]
commit_message:
puppet: xenial jobs are now -nv

Because:
* we're having unknown issues with Zuul and Ansible (async), a lot of
  jobs are randomly failing.
* we're having random failures in Tempest tests when using Newton
  packaging from Ubuntu.

Things are unstable now. Hopefully we have more stable jobs with CentOS7
that allow us to keep jobs in gate to actually do testing.
Until we have the same situation for Ubuntu, let's make them non-voting.

Revert this patch once things get better.

Change-Id: I728692038b3b9700c09d37ce6e5c3c4716517df0

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-06-21 09:00:47.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/cinder-api-ssl-08f7be7fe02510c7.yaml', 'manifests/api.pp', 'manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/cinder_api_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/cinder_spec.rb'], 'message': "Move SSL parameters to api.pp

Most of the other services configure their SSL options in the api.pp.
So for consistency, they were moved here too. The old SSL parameters
have been kept for backwards compatibility, so they should still

This also configures TLS in the correct group. As Cinder uses

Change-Id: I4d35016cb1ecda7e4dc133de7c58e0f239ff8517

commit_message:
Move SSL parameters to api.pp

Most of the other services configure their SSL options in the api.pp.
So for consistency, they were moved here too. The old SSL parameters
have been kept for backwards compatibility, so they should still
work.

This also configures TLS in the correct group. As Cinder uses
sslutils from oslo_service. So with the previous configuration.
puppet-cinder didn't actually enable TLS.

Change-Id: I4d35016cb1ecda7e4dc133de7c58e0f239ff8517

subject: Fix resource ordering for neutron-ovs-cleanup service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-21 15:11:49.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb', 'manifests/agents/ml2/ovs.pp'], 'message': 'Fix resource ordering for neutron-ovs-cleanup service

In RDO neutron-ovs-cleanup service script is packaged in
openstack-neutron package instead of openstack-neutron-openvswitch.
So, we need to wait for openstack-neutron packages installation
before managing neutron-ovs-cleanup service.

This commit could be reverted when bug [0] is resolved.

[0] - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1065826

Change-Id: I6bb31a74fee883dfb35ea71b92ff37d24b4eaab5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix resource ordering for neutron-ovs-cleanup service

In RDO neutron-ovs-cleanup service script is packaged in
openstack-neutron package instead of openstack-neutron-openvswitch.
So, we need to wait for openstack-neutron packages installation
before managing neutron-ovs-cleanup service.

This commit could be reverted when bug [0] is resolved.

[0] - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1065826

Change-Id: I6bb31a74fee883dfb35ea71b92ff37d24b4eaab5

revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2016-06-23 13:48:41.000000000', 'files': ['octane/patches/fuel_agent/patch', 'octane/magic_consts.py', 'octane/commands/patch_active_image.py', 'octane/tests/test_patch_active_img.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add patch-active-img command

Required for creating new patched bootstrap image
based on active bootstrap image.

It patches active bootstrap image to skip the step
that add UEFI.

Note:

* You should active your patched image using command:

    fuel-bootstrap activate <img_uuid>

* squashfs-tools should be installed on master node

    yum install squashfs-tools

Usage:

    octane patch-active-img

Closes-bug: 1575054

Change-Id: I7b12db209b5d2db158d4c26bc162bab504aa1590
'}]
commit_message:
Add patch-active-img command

Required for creating new patched bootstrap image
based on active bootstrap image.

It patches active bootstrap image to skip the step
that add UEFI.

Note:

* You should active your patched image using command:

    fuel-bootstrap activate <img_uuid>

* squashfs-tools should be installed on master node

    yum install squashfs-tools

Usage:

    octane patch-active-img

Closes-bug: 1575054

Change-Id: I7b12db209b5d2db158d4c26bc162bab504aa1590

subject: Fixes IronicApiService.deleteNode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 07:45:41.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/services/IronicApiService.js'], 'message': 'Fixes IronicApiService.deleteNode

IronicApiService.deleteNode still uses the old "when(request(...))"
format to make xhr request, not the refactored "this.defaultRequest"
method. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Iaf4cc1664a5fc61f84f91bbb2b54f79860b1ce34
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes IronicApiService.deleteNode

IronicApiService.deleteNode still uses the old "when(request(...))"
format to make xhr request, not the refactored "this.defaultRequest"
method. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Iaf4cc1664a5fc61f84f91bbb2b54f79860b1ce34

subject: Improve the impl_rabbit logging
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-06-07 17:21:50.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Improve the impl_rabbit logging

It would be better if we could log a client port and some additional
information about a connection, to understand where is problems occurs.
The client port especially helpful for associating events in a rabbitmq.log
with oslo.messaging logs.

Change-Id: I0dae619f5a1688fb2f64fd90623fde2444609f04
'}]
commit_message:
Improve the impl_rabbit logging

It would be better if we could log a client port and some additional
information about a connection, to understand where is problems occurs.
The client port especially helpful for associating events in a rabbitmq.log
with oslo.messaging logs.

Change-Id: I0dae619f5a1688fb2f64fd90623fde2444609f04

subject: oslo.concurrency 2.6.1 for Liberty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-22 10:44:30.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/liberty/oslo.concurrency.yaml'], 'message': 'oslo.concurrency 2.6.1 for Liberty

The main change is the addition of a new prlimit parameter to
processutils.  This change is needed by the Nova change
I135b5242af1bfdcb0ea09a6fcda21fc03a6fbe7d in Liberty to fix a
security vulnerability: "qemu-img calls need to be restricted by
ulimit (CVE-2015-5162)" (see related bug).

    $ git log efb6c0..d65d93 --oneline
    d65d931 processutils: add support for missing process limits
    e33f64f Add prlimit parameter to execute()
    306cf37 Updated from global requirements
    d0de35f Updated from global requirements
    725e2f4 Updated from global requirements
    d65a8b8 Update .gitreview for stable/liberty

Change-Id: If6541215438f92139a9ced2cbf5b2bd4cfe41546
Related-Bug: #1449062
'}]
commit_message:
oslo.concurrency 2.6.1 for Liberty

The main change is the addition of a new prlimit parameter to
processutils.  This change is needed by the Nova change
I135b5242af1bfdcb0ea09a6fcda21fc03a6fbe7d in Liberty to fix a
security vulnerability: "qemu-img calls need to be restricted by
ulimit (CVE-2015-5162)" (see related bug).

    $ git log efb6c0..d65d93 --oneline
    d65d931 processutils: add support for missing process limits
    e33f64f Add prlimit parameter to execute()
    306cf37 Updated from global requirements
    d0de35f Updated from global requirements
    725e2f4 Updated from global requirements
    d65a8b8 Update .gitreview for stable/liberty

Change-Id: If6541215438f92139a9ced2cbf5b2bd4cfe41546
Related-Bug: #1449062

subject: Ammend the current-tripleo repo to point to centos.org rdo-trunk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 13:21:09.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': "Ammend the current-tripleo repo to point to centos.org rdo-trunk

--reposetup is trying to get
http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current-tripleo/delorean.repo
which gives us a 302 that we don't follow. This makes
http://buildlogs.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/rdo-trunk-master-tripleo/
be the repo url and also adds the -L flag to the curl commands so
they would follow any such redirects

Change-Id: I10fed1707621d532a7951c6e335da22eeecd6492
"}]
commit_message:
Ammend the current-tripleo repo to point to centos.org rdo-trunk

--reposetup is trying to get
http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current-tripleo/delorean.repo
which gives us a 302 that we don't follow. This makes
http://buildlogs.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/rdo-trunk-master-tripleo/
be the repo url and also adds the -L flag to the curl commands so
they would follow any such redirects

Change-Id: I10fed1707621d532a7951c6e335da22eeecd6492

This patch implements PCI-DSS change password requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.4: Change user passwords/passphrases at least once every

commit_message:
PCI-DSS Change password requirements

This patch implements PCI-DSS change password requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.4: Change user passwords/passphrases at least once every
90 days.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: I2d6335bd1c3095ffb40fc9f4c0e6f0a0ed88b97c

subject: Auto generate ironic.conf.sample file
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-23 09:37:56.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'etc/ironic/README-ironic.conf.sample'], 'message': 'Auto generate ironic.conf.sample file

The ironic.conf.sample is not update to date according to the result
of command "tox -e checkconfig". In fact, it's a waste of time for
both developers and reviewers to handle this file, because we can
generate it by tox env genconfig.

Change-Id: If5136cae8cd6f7a79ed6305a998d178a9f3d764d
'}]
commit_message:
Auto generate ironic.conf.sample file

The ironic.conf.sample is not update to date according to the result
of command "tox -e checkconfig". In fact, it's a waste of time for
both developers and reviewers to handle this file, because we can
generate it by tox env genconfig.

Change-Id: If5136cae8cd6f7a79ed6305a998d178a9f3d764d

commit_message:
Fix some spelling mistakes in heat as follows:

   in heat/contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_auto_scale.py:270:
       mock nova and glance client methods to satisfy contraints,   contraints should be constraints
   in heat/heat_integrationtests/functional/test_resource_group.py:51
       triggering validation of nested resource custom contraints,  contraints should be constraints
   in heat/heat/common/exception.py:258:
      """Keep this for AWS compatiblility."""    compatiblility should be compatibility
   in heat/heat/engine/resources/openstack/ceilometer/alarm.py:349:
      1) so we don't create watch tasks unneccessarly ,  unneccessarly should be unnecessarily

   in heat/heat/engine/resources/openstack/neutron/vpnservice.py:462:
     The Internet Key Exchange policy identifyies the authentication and , identifyies  should be identifies

   in heat/heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py:1426:
      if 'security_groups' present for the server and explict 'port' , explict should be explicit

   in heat/heat/engine/service.py:182:
     releasing the lock to avoid race condtitions. condtitions should be conditions

   in heat/heat/engine/sync_point.py:134:
       don't aggresively spin; induce some sleep, aggresively should be aggressively

   in heat/heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_software_deployment.py:889:
       Test bug 1332355, where details contains a translateable message, translateable should be translatable

   in heat/heat/tests/test_environment.py:596:
       make sure the parent env is uneffected, uneffected should be unaffected

   in heat/heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py:472:
      'ignorning it or by replacing the entire server.'),  ignorning should be ignoring

   in heat/contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/cloud_server.py:104:
     'retained for compatability.'),  compatability should be compatibility

   in heat/heat/engine/stack.py:1258:
      " ID %(trvsl_id)s, not trigerring rollback."),  trigerring should be triggering.

Change-Id: Ic4ddb65dbfaf61751a330b853780689209f9f4b5
Closes-Bug: #1595376

commit_message:
Fix concurrency issue with snmp pollsters

pysnmp oneliner.CommandGenerator() is not thread safe.

This change creates one oneliner.CommandGenerator() per query to fix
the issue.

Closes-bug: #1576577

Change-Id: Ibf32c068abed5d7198150bc206987f050a093cd8
(cherry picked from commit c898ecd921123eab61a8f88e61686ab4edf82b35)

    mounted, in case it has a value (node search is active)

'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/floating_ip_dns.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/storage/rbd_utils.py'], 'message': "[python3] Port more code to python3

* use list() to make sure we fully convert map(), filter(), dict.values()
  to a list before using it.
* use six.moves for modules like urllib, itertools.izip, xrange
* use operator.itemgetter() to sort list of dict(s) properly
* use string.ascii_letters instead of string.letters
* ensure input to six.StringIO is a string
* listdir() sometimes gets an integer in the first parameter, we
  need to tolerate that behavior
* fix mocks in some tests to work properly
* fix some tests to compare with bytes instead of strings (more
  in the next review)
* ensure XenAPI.Failure is set to the fake Failure class or it
  breaks tests

  (for password length)
* hashlib's sha1 has digest_size in python3 (not digestsize)
* ensure first parameter to six.reraise is a class and not the
  actual exception object

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

Change-Id: I29509e923019760d8b98ae8463c5146ae02aa4c8
"}]
commit_message:
[python3] Port more code to python3

* use list() to make sure we fully convert map(), filter(), dict.values()
  to a list before using it.
* use six.moves for modules like urllib, itertools.izip, xrange
* use operator.itemgetter() to sort list of dict(s) properly
* use string.ascii_letters instead of string.letters
* ensure input to six.StringIO is a string
* listdir() sometimes gets an integer in the first parameter, we
  need to tolerate that behavior
* fix mocks in some tests to work properly
* fix some tests to compare with bytes instead of strings (more
  in the next review)
* ensure XenAPI.Failure is set to the fake Failure class or it
  breaks tests
* make sure we use an integer before we compare with an integer
  (for password length)
* hashlib's sha1 has digest_size in python3 (not digestsize)
* ensure first parameter to six.reraise is a class and not the
  actual exception object

commit_message:
Fixing ordering of 'severity' in alarms

The ordering of severity in alarms is done
alphabetically. It would be more appropriate
if the ordering is done based on value of
severity. This patch fixes the ordering.

Closes-bug: #1452254
Co-Authored-By: liusheng <liusheng@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I69531e3b53a11026a35a40a415f48b7bb838010b

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-06-21 06:59:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Fix snapshot stuck in 'deleting' after reboot c-v

When cascade deleting volume and snapshot, reboot
cinder-volume, snapshot will be stuck in 'deleting'
after it, and it's more worse that user can't delete
this snapshot even reset its status, since no deleting
volume is exitsing any more after init host.

Fix this bug by using cascade deleting volume
when init host, as any volume that is in deleting
status has already passed API checks and should
be deleted with all its snapshots.

Change-Id: Ic47290b8b7004b9e37d096f52af025931ab13c6c
Closes-Bug: #1586604
"}]
commit_message:
Fix snapshot stuck in 'deleting' after reboot c-v

When cascade deleting volume and snapshot, reboot
cinder-volume, snapshot will be stuck in 'deleting'
after it, and it's more worse that user can't delete
this snapshot even reset its status, since no deleting
volume is exitsing any more after init host.

Fix this bug by using cascade deleting volume
when init host, as any volume that is in deleting
status has already passed API checks and should
be deleted with all its snapshots.

Change-Id: Ic47290b8b7004b9e37d096f52af025931ab13c6c
Closes-Bug: #1586604

commit_message:
Allow flavor creation for non admin projects

Heat's recent policy changes reduced the scope of context_is_admin
to be super user privileged which affects Tacker for auto flavor
creation.

Handle devstack script changes to modify OS::Nova::Flavor rule to
'admin' role only in heat's policy.json. Modify manual installation
guide to incorporate these additional steps.

Co-Authored-By: Bharath Thiruveedula <bharath_ves@hotmail.com>

Change-Id: I7aceb21cbfaa6c45efa5c815a9bf7a0a26babc77
Closes-Bug: #1595311

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-16 14:57:49.000000000', 'files': ['resolutions/20160217-mission-amendment.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'resolutions/superseded/index.rst', 'resolutions/20160119-stackforge-retirement.rst', 'resolutions/superseded/20150615-stackforge-retirement.rst', 'resolutions/superseded/20160106-mission-amendment.rst'], 'message': 'Preserve superseded resolutions

For the stackforge resolution, this commit adds the text of the

explanatory text noting what the update is and the reason for it.
It also reverts the text of the original resolution to that which

commit_message:
Preserve superseded resolutions

Rather than directly amending a previously-passed resolution, the TC
has decided the change should be a new resolution.

For the stackforge resolution, this commit adds the text of the
updated resolution as a new resolution with some introductory
explanatory text noting what the update is and the reason for it.
It also reverts the text of the original resolution to that which
was originally passed and adds a new section at the bottom of the
original resolution which indicates it is amended by a subsequent
resolution and links to it.

The superseded resolutions are placed in a specific folder for
clarity. The same process was applied to the Mission statement
resolution.

Change-Id: I446d0797554311b199fce999a7469dbf4e3a2d30

commit_message:
hacking: check for assertTrue(isinstance(a, b))

This hacking prevents future mistakes
The correct way is assertIsInstance(A, B) provided
by testtools.

Change-Id: I4689690a429e5db366b91561be5e02f3435a0669
Related-Bug: #1268480

revisions:
[{'number': 44, 'created': '2016-06-21 04:43:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/client/session.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/client/objects.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vif.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/fake.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/client/test_session.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vif.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/client/test_objects.py', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/nova_plugin_version', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/xenhost'], 'message': "XenAPI: OVS agent updates the wrong port with Neutron

With xen hypervisor, it will create two sets of port/interface
for each VM vif: One is named as tapx.y which is qemu-emulated
NIC and is used when no PV drivers installed with the VM; The
other one is named as vifx.0 which is the xen network frontend
NIC and is used when VM has PV drivers installed. But neutron
only handle one port. If the finally used port is not the one
handled by neutron, the guest VM will have no network access.
The solution is to change nova xenapi to add a bridge, which
we call the 'interim bridge', between the VM and the OVS
integration bridge. In this way it will only expose to neutron
with the integration bridge's port which connected to the
interim bridge. So it will fix the issue mentioned above.

Closes-Bug: #1268955

Change-Id: I0cfc0284e1fcd1a6169d31a7ad410716037e5cc2
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: OVS agent updates the wrong port with Neutron

With xen hypervisor, it will create two sets of port/interface
for each VM vif: One is named as tapx.y which is qemu-emulated
NIC and is used when no PV drivers installed with the VM; The
other one is named as vifx.0 which is the xen network frontend
NIC and is used when VM has PV drivers installed. But neutron
only handle one port. If the finally used port is not the one
handled by neutron, the guest VM will have no network access.
The solution is to change nova xenapi to add a bridge, which
we call the 'interim bridge', between the VM and the OVS
integration bridge. In this way it will only expose to neutron
with the integration bridge's port which connected to the
interim bridge. So it will fix the issue mentioned above.

Closes-Bug: #1268955

Change-Id: I0cfc0284e1fcd1a6169d31a7ad410716037e5cc2

commit_message:
WIP: Only use path_mtu for determining Vxlan MTU

If path_mtu is set to a positive value, we only want to use that value
for calculation the effective MTU after subtracting the encapsulation
overhead.

The setting of global_physnet_mtu should not affect the MTU for tunneled
network types.

Change-Id: Idaa37ac8a90708c9666f675ef7b40921c8f6c102
Closes-Bug: 1592017

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14819, 'name': 'Timofey Durakov', 'email': 'timofei.nd@gmail.com', 'username': 'tdurakov'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 21:41:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "Don't attempt to lazy-load tags on a deleted instance

Since we don't have a specific handler for lazy-loading
tags on an Instance object it loads generically but
that will fail with an InstanceNotFound on a deleted
instance, so just handle this in obj_load_attr like we
do for 'services'. Note we can't call the TagList object
to load the tags for us since the DB API will fail if
the instance is deleted too.

Change-Id: If3580dcc3e83f612b96a2c3ad893a5045ee6100a
Related-Bug: #1592963
"}]
commit_message:
Don't attempt to lazy-load tags on a deleted instance

Since we don't have a specific handler for lazy-loading
tags on an Instance object it loads generically but
that will fail with an InstanceNotFound on a deleted
instance, so just handle this in obj_load_attr like we
do for 'services'. Note we can't call the TagList object
to load the tags for us since the DB API will fail if
the instance is deleted too.

Change-Id: If3580dcc3e83f612b96a2c3ad893a5045ee6100a
Related-Bug: #1592963

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-12-17 19:14:55.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_members_resource.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/api/v2/image_members.py', 'releasenotes/notes/image-member-name-length-validation-8e50e43273804f99.yaml', 'glance/api/v1/members.py'], 'message': 'Image member name validation

When adding a new member to an image whose id is longer than 255
characters an Internal Server Error occurs (500). It's caused by
database restriction which defines member field as varchar(255). The
issue affects both - API v1 and v2.

Following patch provides simple validation to check if provided member
name is not longer than 255 characters and if so - Bad Request (400) is
returned with proper message.

Additionally membership schema has been "activated" at v2 request
deserializer to provide better way of handling any kind of validation.

DocImpact
ApiImpact
Closes-Bug: #1424038
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I21c84d4af8481edbe867fe04d57ce154931fde5d
'}]
commit_message:
Image member name validation

When adding a new member to an image whose id is longer than 255
characters an Internal Server Error occurs (500). It's caused by
database restriction which defines member field as varchar(255). The
issue affects both - API v1 and v2.

Following patch provides simple validation to check if provided member
name is not longer than 255 characters and if so - Bad Request (400) is
returned with proper message.

Additionally membership schema has been "activated" at v2 request
deserializer to provide better way of handling any kind of validation.

DocImpact
ApiImpact
Closes-Bug: #1424038
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I21c84d4af8481edbe867fe04d57ce154931fde5d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-21 19:05:51.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/roles/admin.pp'], 'message': 'roles/admin: make sure role is created after admin user / tenant

This patch secures orchestration when deploying admin resources

tenant before creating the actualy role.

commit_message:
roles/admin: make sure role is created after admin user / tenant

This patch secures orchestration when deploying admin resources
(tenants, user, role) by making sure we first manage admin user and
tenant before creating the actualy role.

It will avoid Keystone_user_role[admin@admin] to run before
Keystone_user[admin] in catalog.

Change-Id: I8ab31612997c84e6061ae2f46d436bd420235b23

commit_message:
Replace assertRaisesRegexp with assertRaisesRegex

This patch replace assertRaisesRegexp with
assertRaisesRegex which is deprecated in python3
https://docs.python.org/3.2/library/unittest.html
Also it update the base tests to be oslotest
BaseTestCase for python2.7 and python3 compatibility

Change-Id: I02571946f0643247e208d98dc91ea78cd9d351ee

commit_message:
Report dates in local time for dos.py show and snapshot-list commands

- Added helper to convert utc datetime to local
- Django's TIME_ZONE set to None, to allow detection of system
  timezone
- logging time stays in UTC

Change-Id: I436fbae196c86f1a8d7555ebe3e0f405a53b0d3e
Closes-Bug: #1586212

commit_message:
Fix dos.py slave-add command

- Fixed group.add_node call.
- Added print message if group not found
- Added get_available_slave_name to prevent
  using existing names
- Added GROUP-NAME column to dos.py show

Closes-Bug: #1583452

commit_message:
Update pagination marker when del last row

When last row is deleted via ajax update, change pagination marker
to use id (get from 'data-object-id' attr) in pervious row.

If no item in the table, and it has next page, reload current page

Change-Id: I2d5e2bc418977e59af006944c0105fe78e5e7c48
Closes-Bug: #1255562

subject: Wait for 404 on floatingip delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-22 22:54:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/neutron/floatingip.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/neutron/test_neutron_floating_ip.py'], 'message': 'Wait for 404 on floatingip delete

Currently the FloatingIP resource assumes that delete is an atomic
operation, but there have been reports of downstream dependency
deletes failing because the floatingip still exists.

This change triggers the standard neutron resource
check_delete_complete 404 polling to ensure the floatingip really is
gone.

Change-Id: I9be34ef8b64a79d3211841cb7a7acd945f1f107c
Closes-Bug: #1595270
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for 404 on floatingip delete

Currently the FloatingIP resource assumes that delete is an atomic
operation, but there have been reports of downstream dependency
deletes failing because the floatingip still exists.

This change triggers the standard neutron resource
check_delete_complete 404 polling to ensure the floatingip really is
gone.

Change-Id: I9be34ef8b64a79d3211841cb7a7acd945f1f107c
Closes-Bug: #1595270

commit_message:
Add user & user_role parameters in auth manifest and related tests

Add configure_user & configure_user_role parameters in auth manifest
and so that users can disable if required. By default, these are
set to true.

And add related tests for disable user & user_role params.

Change-Id: Ic45e636d2b8e6b8c2684389d1d4836900d7e8911
Closes-Bug: #1587859
